intro: Linociera mayottensis, commonly known as the Mayotte hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands, specifically Mayotte. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are known for their fragrance and nectar production. Linociera mayottensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
